title: Money & Worth
description: Heal your relationship with money by addressing the deeper issues of self-worth, family patterns, and inherited beliefs.
curriculum: Understanding your emotional relationship with money
Uncovering inherited money patterns and beliefs
Healing money wounds and scarcity consciousness
Building a conscious relationship with money
outcomes: Understand the emotional roots of money patterns
Identify inherited beliefs about money and worth
Heal money wounds and scarcity patterns
Develop a conscious, healthy money relationship
Build sustainable financial wellbeing from self-worth

modules.title: Your Money Story
modules.description: Understanding your emotional relationship with money

modules.title: Inherited Money Patterns
modules.description: What you learned about money from family

modules.title: Worth and Net Worth
modules.description: Separating who you are from what you have

modules.title: Integration and Abundance
modules.description: Sustainable financial wellbeing from the inside out

requirements: Willingness to examine emotional relationship with money
Openness to looking at family money patterns
Some financial stability (not in acute crisis)

questions.question: What is the main insight about money patterns?
options: Money is purely logical and emotions don't matter
Our relationship with money is deeply emotional and often inherited
Everyone should have the same money values
Financial problems are always about income

questions.question: What is scarcity consciousness?
options: A healthy awareness of limited resources
A mindset where there's never enough, regardless of actual resources
Being smart about spending
A financial planning strategy

questions.question: Why is separating worth from net worth important?
options: It helps you ignore financial realities
Rich people are always worthy, poor people aren't
Your value as a person isn't determined by money
Net worth doesn't matter at all

questions.question: How do family money patterns typically get transmitted?
options: Primarily through formal financial education
Through observation, atmosphere, and implicit learning
They don't get transmitted at all
Only through inheritance

questions.question: What is a conscious relationship with money?
options: Never thinking about money
Being obsessed with money
Aware, intentional engagement with money aligned to values
Avoiding all spending
